themes: skepticism about government role in art
support for funding established musicians and songwriters
critique of funding for inexperienced or unproven artists
emphasis on artistic quality as a draw for audiences
key_phrases: Government involvement does not make art better
Grants to help successfully working musicians and songwriters keep working are good
Money given to people who just want to give it a go is not helpful
The better the music, the more people will come here to hear it
barriers_identified: funding allocated to inexperienced artists is seen as ineffective
solutions_proposed: prioritize grants for established, working musicians and songwriters
